newsitem.title: FRANCE: Publicis, True North settle row.
newsitem.headline: Publicis, True North settle row.

text.p: Advertising agency Publicis said in a statement it had settled all outstanding differences with its former U.S. ally True North and would develop under its own name a global network of agencies.
It added it would wholly own the Publicis FCB Europe joint venture.

Publicis will transfer to True North the FCB agencies in Paris, London, Lisbon and Athens where Publicis already has a strong presence. In return True North will transfer to Publicis "a portion" of its 49 percent stake in Publicis FCB Europe.
The remaining stake will be converted to an increased True North shareholding in Publicis Communication, the advertising operating unit of Publicis SA.

The European network will take the name of Publicis Europe and will be wholly-owned by Publicis Communication in which Publicis will have a 73.5 percent stake -- against 79.2 percent previously -- and True North will have 26.5 percent instead of a previous 20.8 percent stake.
Publicis will maintain its 20 percent stake in True North and will be its largest shareholder. The two companies will continue to hold a seat on the other's board of directors.

True North will also sell to Publicis its interest in the South African agency, The Partnership, and a majority interest in agencies either existing or to be spun-off from existing agencies in Argentina, Australia, New Zealand, India and Thailand.
Publicis and FCB will enter into long-term service agreements to serve each other's clients in countries where the other does not yet have a presence.
The agencies have agreed to facilitate alignment of multinational clients within their respective agency networks in accordance with client wishes.
Publicis and True North will seek ways to cooperate on media-buying on a global basis and both companies will withdraw their respective legal claims against each other.
